qas.question: What does Canada being referred to as the 51st state in a positive way mean in the US, generally?

answers.text: can serve to highlight the similarities and close relationship between the United States and Canada

qas.question: What is a negative connotation of the term?

answers.text: to deride Canada as an unimportant neighbor

qas.question: How man votes did Parti 51 attract in 1989?
What did the other parties receive that year?

plausible_answers.text: can serve to highlight the similarities and close relationship between the United States and Canada

qas.question: What does Quebec being referred to as the 51st state in a joking way mean in the US, generally/

plausible_answers.text: to deride Canada as an unimportant neighbor

qas.question: What is a negative connotation of Andre Perron?
How many votes did the United States attract in 1989?
What did the other parties receive in 1988?
When did the political party Parti 51 run 51 candidates on a platform of Quebec seceding from Canada to join the United States?

context: In the United States, the term "the 51st state" when applied to Canada <a0_0><b4_0>can serve to highlight the similarities and close relationship between the United States and Canada<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Sometimes the term is used disparagingly, intended <a1_0><b5_0>to deride Canada as an unimportant neighbor<b5_0/><a1_0/>. In the Quebec general election, <b8_0>1989<b8_0/>, the political party Parti 51 ran 11 candidates on a platform of Quebec seceding from Canada to join the United States (with its leader, André Perron, claiming Quebec could not survive as an independent nation). The party attracted <a2_0>just <b6_0>3,846 votes<b6_0/><a2_0/> across the province, 0.11% of the total votes cast. In comparison, the other parties in favour of sovereignty of Quebec in that election got <a3_0><b7_0>40.16% (PQ) and 1.22% (NPDQ)<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
